AgentComposeRequest.description: Compose an agent from prompt, tools, and LLM config (without api_key).
AgentComposeRequest.title: AgentComposeRequest

Blueprint.description: A design-time workflow blueprint transferable over the wire.
Blueprint.title: Blueprint

BlueprintCreateResponse.description:
Response for blueprint creation.

Args:
    id (str): Assigned blueprint identifier.
    version_lock (str): Version lock for optimistic concurrency.

Returns:
    BlueprintCreateResponse: Response model containing identifiers.
BlueprintCreateResponse.title: BlueprintCreateResponse

ComponentDefinition.description:
Definition for a new component to validate and potentially register.

This enables validating tool/agent/workflow definitions BEFORE registration,
ensuring only valid components enter the registry.

agent_tools.description: List of tool names this agent can use
agent_tools.title: Agent Tools

code_class_code.description: Python code defining a code-node implementation class with async execute(workflow, cfg, ctx) -> dict
code_class_code.title: Code Class Code

code_factory_code.description: Python code defining a *factory function* for a code node (returns an implementation or callable)
code_factory_code.title: Code Factory Code

tool_class_code.description: Python code defining the tool class (must inherit from ToolBase)
tool_class_code.title: Tool Class Code

tool_factory_code.description: Python code defining a *factory function* that returns ToolBase
tool_factory_code.title: Tool Factory Code

workflow_nodes.description: Nodes that make up the workflow
workflow_nodes.title: Workflow Nodes

ComponentDefinition.title: ComponentDefinition

ComponentRegisterResponse.description: Extends validation result with persistence metadata.

component_id.description: Unique ID assigned to the component
component_id.title: Component Id

errors.description: Validation errors that must be fixed
errors.title: Errors

registry_name.description: Name used in registry (may differ from definition.name)
registry_name.title: Registry Name

ComponentRegisterResponse.title: ComponentRegisterResponse

ComponentScaffoldRequest.description:
Request to scaffold a new component's starter code.

Args:
    type: Component type ("tool" | "agent" | "workflow" | "code")
    name: Desired public name
    template: Optional template variant hint (e.g., "basic", "llm")
ComponentScaffoldRequest.title: ComponentScaffoldRequest

ComponentScaffoldResponse.description:
Response containing scaffolded code and notes.

Returns:
    tool_factory_code/tool_class_code/agent_factory_code/code_factory_code depending on type
    notes: Guidance for the caller
ComponentScaffoldResponse.title: ComponentScaffoldResponse

component_id.description: Unique ID assigned to the component
component_id.title: Component Id

errors.description: Validation errors that must be fixed
errors.title: Errors

registry_name.description: Name used in registry (may differ from definition.name)
registry_name.title: Registry Name

DraftPayload.description:
Draft payload model.

Attributes
----------
data : dict[str, Any]
    Opaque draft data produced by the builder.
version : int
    Optimistic concurrency version number (monotonic, starts at 1).

Example
-------
>>> DraftPayload(data={"nodes": [], "metadata": {"draft_name": "wip"}}, version=1)
DraftPayload.title: DraftPayload

ExecutionStartRequest.description:
Request body to start a workflow execution.

Args:
    blueprint_id (str): Identifier of a previously stored blueprint.
    inputs (Dict[str, Any] | None): Optional initial inputs passed to the workflow.

Returns:
    None

inputs.description: Optional initial inputs for the workflow
inputs.title: Inputs

ExecutionStartRequest.title: ExecutionStartRequest

ExecutionStartResponse.description:
Response for starting a workflow execution.

Args:
    execution_id (str): Identifier for the created execution.
    status (str): Current status (accepted, running, completed, failed, timeout).
    result (Dict[str, Any] | None): Final result when completed.

Returns:
    ExecutionStartResponse: Response model containing execution details.
ExecutionStartResponse.title: ExecutionStartResponse

NodeCatalog.description: High-level node catalog for authoring UIs and copilots.
NodeCatalog.title: NodeCatalog

NodePatch.description:
A minimal, declarative mutation to a partial blueprint.

This captures add/remove/update operations in a way that can be validated
without executing any code.
NodePatch.title: NodePatch

NodeSchema.description: Pydantic JSON Schema for a node configuration class.
NodeSchema.title: NodeSchema

NodeSpec.description: JSON-friendly node description (same keys as NodeConfig).
NodeSpec.title: NodeSpec

PartialBlueprint.description: Blueprint under construction with validation relaxed.

is_complete.description: Whether blueprint is ready for execution
is_complete.title: Is Complete

nodes.description: Nodes added so far (can be empty)
nodes.title: Nodes

PartialBlueprint.title: PartialBlueprint

PartialNodeSpec.description: Node spec that allows pending connections.

pending_outputs.description: Output fields that could connect to other nodes
pending_outputs.title: Pending Outputs

PartialNodeSpec.title: PartialNodeSpec

PreviewToolRequest.description:
Request to preview-execute a generated code tool in a sandbox.

Parameters
----------
language : str
    Programming language ("python" or "javascript").
code : str
    Inline code to execute.
inputs : dict[str, Any]
    Runtime inputs passed to the code node.
imports : list[str]
    Optional allowed imports for the sandbox.
timeout_seconds : int | None
    Optional overall timeout for the execution (seconds).

Example
-------
>>> PreviewToolRequest(language="python", code="print('hi')", inputs={})
PreviewToolRequest.title: PreviewToolRequest

StorageHealth.description:
Storage subsystem health response.

Returns
-------
StorageHealth
    The current storage backend and status.

Example
-------
>>> StorageHealth(backend="redis", status="ready").model_dump()
{'backend': 'redis', 'status': 'ready'}
StorageHealth.title: StorageHealth

ToolInfo.description:
Catalog entry for a Tool node.

Attributes
----------
name : str
    Registry name of the tool factory.
input_schema : dict[str, Any]
    JSON Schema describing expected inputs.
output_schema : dict[str, Any]
    JSON Schema describing outputs.
ui_hints : dict[str, UIHints] | None
    Optional mapping of field name to UI hints.
examples : list[dict[str, Any]] | None
    Example argument objects usable in studio.

name.description: Registry name of the tool factory
name.title: Name

ToolInfo.title: ToolInfo

UIHints.description: Optional UI rendering hints for studio forms.
UIHints.title: UIHints

ice_api__api__mcp__SuggestRequest.description:
Request for suggestions for next nodes.

Args:
    top_k: Maximum number of suggestions to return
    allowed_types: Optional filter of node types to include
    commit: If true, persist summary suggestions and roll lock (requires X-Version-Lock)
ice_api__api__mcp__SuggestRequest.title: SuggestRequest

get.description: Root endpoint returning API info.

post.description: Main MCP JSON-RPC 2.0 handler with comprehensive error handling.

schema.title: Response Mcp Jsonrpc Handler Api Mcp  Post

post.description:
Create a simple agent definition and register via component pipeline.

Not BYOK: any `api_key` field in llm_config is ignored.
Register (or upsert) a *Blueprint*.

Create a new design session for incremental blueprint building.

This supports the Frosty/Canvas workflow where:
1. User starts a design session
2. Validates and registers components as needed
3. Incrementally builds blueprint with PartialBlueprint
4. Gets real-time validation and suggestions
5. Finalizes when ready

schema.title: Response Create Design Session Api Mcp Blueprints Design Session Post

get.description: Get current state of a design session.

schema.title: Response Get Design Session Api Mcp Blueprints Design Session  Session Id  Get

post.description: Track that a component was registered in this design session.

schema.title: Response Register Session Component Api Mcp Blueprints Design Session  Session Id  Register Component Post

post.description: Create a new partial blueprint for incremental construction.

get.description: Return stored PartialBlueprint JSON and expose current lock in header.

schema.title: Response Get Partial Blueprint Api Mcp Blueprints Partial  Blueprint Id  Get

put.description: Update a partial blueprint - add/remove/modify nodes.

post.description: Convert partial blueprint to executable blueprint.

Return deterministic suggestions for next nodes based on partial blueprint.

- No side effects by default.
- If body.commit==True, requires X-Version-Lock and persists a summary to partial.next_suggestions.

get.description: Retrieve a registered blueprint by ID.

schema.title: Response Get Blueprint Api Mcp Blueprints  Blueprint Id  Get

get.description: Get visualization data for a blueprint.

schema.title: Response Get Blueprint Visualization Api Mcp Blueprints  Blueprint Id  Visualization Get

post.description:
Single chat turn with simple session memory stored in Redis.

- Resolves data-first AgentDefinition if present.
- Builds an LLM node on-the-fly using the agent's llm_config and system_prompt.
- Persists message history per (agent_name, session_id) in Redis.

get.description: List stored components from the Redis index plus current registry view.

schema.title: Response List All Components Api Mcp Components Get

post.description: Validate then persist a component definition and register it (via service).

Generate starter code for a new component.

- For tools: provide a minimal ToolBase subclass and factory template.
- For agents: provide an agent factory using `agent_factory` decorator.
- For workflows: currently out-of-scope; recommend building via blueprint.

Validate a component definition and optionally auto-register if valid.

This enables the Frosty/Canvas workflow where components are validated
BEFORE registration, ensuring only valid components enter the registry.

Flow:
1. Submit component definition (tool/agent/workflow)
2. Validate structure, dependencies, conflicts
3. If valid and auto_register=true, register the component
4. Return validation results with suggestions

get.description: List all registered components of a given type.

schema.title: Response List Components By Type Api Mcp Components  Component Type  Get

delete.description: Delete a stored component definition and remove it from the index.

get.description: Fetch a stored component definition and expose current version lock.

schema.title: Response Get Component Api Mcp Components  Component Type   Name  Get

put.description: Update a stored component; requires X-Version-Lock optimistic concurrency.

schema.title: Response Update Component Api Mcp Components  Component Type   Name  Put

post.description: Execute a blueprint by *id* or inline definition and return *run_id*.

get.description: Return the final *RunResult* if available, else 202.
Stream events for *run_id* via Server-Sent Events.
Get comprehensive graph analysis including paths, bottlenecks, and optimization suggestions.

schema.title: Response Get Workflow Graph Analysis Api Mcp Workflows  Workflow Id  Graph Analysis Get

get.description: Get intelligent layout hints for canvas visualization.

schema.title: Response Get Workflow Layout Hints Api Mcp Workflows  Workflow Id  Graph Layout Get

get.description: Get comprehensive graph analysis metrics for a workflow.

schema.title: Response Get Workflow Graph Metrics Api Mcp Workflows  Workflow Id  Graph Metrics Get

post.description: Find similar patterns in the workflow for refactoring opportunities.

schema.title: Response Find Workflow Patterns Api Mcp Workflows  Workflow Id  Graph Patterns Post

get.description: Analyze the impact of changes to a specific node.

schema.title: Response Analyze Node Impact Api Mcp Workflows  Workflow Id  Nodes  Node Id  Impact Get

get.description: Get AI-powered suggestions for next nodes after the specified node.

schema.title: Response Get Node Suggestions Api Mcp Workflows  Workflow Id  Nodes  Node Id  Suggestions Get

get.description: Return all registered agent names.

schema.title: Response List Agents Api V1 Agents Get

post.description:
Create a blueprint using optimistic concurrency.

Args:
    request (Request): FastAPI request object (used for headers and app state).
    blueprint (Blueprint): Fully-typed Blueprint payload.

Returns:
    BlueprintCreateResponse: Identifier and version lock of the stored blueprint.

Example:
    POST /api/v1/blueprints/ with header X-Version-Lock: __new__ and a Blueprint body.

delete.description: Delete a blueprint after optimistic lock validation.

get.description: Return a stored Blueprint by *id* with optimistic version-lock header.

put.description: Replace an existing blueprint in one shot (optimistic concurrency).

post.description: Create a deep copy of an existing blueprint and return the new id.

delete.description: Delete a draft for the current identity (idempotent).

get.description:
Fetch a draft for the current identity.

Returns current version and data. Raises 404 if not found.

put.description:
Create or update a draft for the current identity.

Uses optimistic concurrency via versioning:
- If request has "If-Match: <version>", update only if current version matches.
- Otherwise create-or-replace and bump version.

post.description:
Run generated code in a strict sandbox without registering it.

Returns structured logs/results; never persists or registers components.

get.description: Return all registered chain names.

schema.title: Response List Chains Api V1 Chains Get
Response Diag Llm Api V1 Diag Llm Get

get.description: List known executions from Redis (authoritative) with basic fields.

parameters.description: Optional: block up to N seconds and return final status/result instead of an execution_id.
parameters.name: wait_seconds

schema.description: Optional: block up to N seconds and return final status/result instead of an execution_id.
schema.title: Wait Seconds

post.description:
Best-effort cancel of a running execution.

MVP semantics: mark status as failed with reason="canceled" and persist.

schema.title: Response Cancel Execution Api V1 Executions  Execution Id  Cancel Post

get.description: Return all registered executors keyed by node_type.

schema.title: Response List Executors Api V1 Executors Get
Response List Assets Api V1 Library Assets Get
Response Add Asset Api V1 Library Assets Post

get.description:
Return a unified listing of components and blueprints.

Filters:
- q: substring match on name/id
- kind: filter to 'component' or 'blueprint'

schema.title: Response List Library Api V1 Library Assets Index Get
Response Delete Asset Api V1 Library Assets  Label  Delete

post.description: Main MCP JSON-RPC 2.0 handler with comprehensive error handling.

schema.title: Response Mcp Jsonrpc Handler Api V1 Mcp  Post

get.description: Return component inventories for dashboards (names only).

schema.title: Response Meta Components Api V1 Meta Components Get

get.description:
Return catalog of nodes with schemas for tools.

Notes
-----
- Tool schemas are discovered from the registered tool factories.
- Other node categories are listed by name at this tier (schemas are
  typically resolved at compile-time or via specialized endpoints).
Return detailed info for a tool, including discovered schemas.
Return supported node type strings (canonical).

schema.title: Response List Node Types Api V1 Meta Nodes Types Get

get.description: Return Pydantic JSON Schema for the given node type.

Return counts and missing executor information.

This endpoint helps ensure the orchestrator registry is fully populated and
matches expectations after initialization and policy filtering.

schema.title: Response Registry Health Api V1 Meta Registry Health Get

get.description:
Return storage mode and basic readiness.

This is a forward-compatible health endpoint. Today it reports the
effective storage backend based on environment configuration. Once a
SQL-backed repository is introduced, this endpoint will also report
current migration head and connection status.
Return app version and build metadata.

schema.title: Response Version Info Api V1 Meta Version Get

post.description:
Issue a new bearer token and persist its hash.

The raw token is returned once; only the hash is stored server-side.

schema.title: Response Revoke Token Api V1 Tokens Revoke Post
Response Delete Token Api V1 Tokens  Token Hash  Delete

get.description: Return all registered tool names.

schema.title: Response List Tools Api V1 Tools Get

post.description:
Upload one or more text files, ingest into semantic memory.

Parameters
----------
files : List[UploadFile]
        One or more files to ingest as plain text.
scope : str
        Semantic memory scope key used for retrieval.
chunk_size : int
        Chunk size in characters for splitting.
overlap : int
        Overlap size between chunks.
metadata_json : str | None
        Optional JSON string of metadata to attach to each chunk (merged with filename).

get.description: Return all registered workflow names.

schema.title: Response List Workflows Api V1 Workflows Get

get.description: Health check endpoint.
Health probe  alias for /livez (kept for compatibility).

schema.title: Response Health Check Legacy Healthz Get

get.description: Liveness probe  returns 200 when process is running.
Readiness probe  returns 200 only after full startup.
